content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is a simple solution in Julia:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    return filter(word -> isuppercase(first(word)), words)
end
```

This function uses the built-in `filter` function to iterate over each word in the provided list. The `isuppercase(first(word))` part checks if the first character of a word is an uppercase letter, and if it is, that word will be included in the return value of the filter operation.

You can use this function like so:
```julia
words = ["dog", "Cat", "Dog", "cat"]
filtered_words = keep_only_names(words)
println(filtered_words)  # Outputs: ["Cat", "Dog"]
```
